reviewText:
Our entire family enjoyed this film, which I recommend for anyone who enjoys a good laugh and a bit of mystery! The roles of all the kids are played very well and I'm sure the older guys will enjoy seeing Denise Richards (nothing too provocative, though).

The mysterious new neighbor has a "monster" in his basement...or does he? Thankfully, nothing preachy or totally ludicrous about O:NW; just fun and laughs for everyone.
I enjoyed it. Real lion, hilarious kids... treehouse. Doesn't get better than that.
Very good plot, acting and camera work. I can see why it was judged best family film of the San Diego Film Festival.
This was not what I expected Not worth buying.
I agree with the other 1 star review. I thought it was going to be 4 star, and it wasn't! Waste of money.

This was a great family movie! The kid actors were fantistic! The story line was well thought out and the plot was amazing. Me & my family thoroughly enjoyed it. Would love to see more of this style of movies for the entire family.

Amazed this is the first 1 star rating. If you're looking for a good family movie, this isn't it, at least the first 30 minutes . We couldn't finish the movie it was that bad. Acting seemed improvised at best. We got sucked into the 4 star rating. Had we known there were only 3 ratings at the time, would have waited.
Not a 5 star movie! Ok kids movie but way too slow storyline and plot was very weak. The sound was terrible too!
